E.g. how long are certain releases of the connector supported and when will be customers forced to upgrade? Will there be automatic upgrades for the cloud? ‚Ä¢   Since blockchains are extremely slow, how will the connector deal with latency and queues?             o Imagine thousands of purchase orders per hour and how long it takes to create smart-contracts on a public blockchain for them.            o How will the slow blockchain transaction be queued or handled asynchronously?            o Will the corresponding records be locked in the ERP while the smart contract is created and the workflow processed?            o What happens when a work order should be modified or updated while the slow smart contract is created?

Author: pumawolf
Title: [ANN] unibright.io - Blockchain based business integration -
Body: Unibright Framework integrating Blockchain to SAP!  We came up with our public demo just a few weeks ago, showing how to design a business process visually and automatically generating and connecting smart contracts. Now, we are happy to present another milestone: Connecting the traditional ERP-World (SAP-, Oracle-, Microsoft-ERP-Systems) to the exciting world of blockchains and decentralized consensus.  In the following video, we give a brief presentation of a business process starting in SAP, continuing in the blockchain, and getting back to SAP again.  In detail, the process we show, is the release of a newly created purchase order:  Creation of a purchase order in SAP Triggering the Unibright Connector to create a multi party approval in a smart contract "Running" the approval process in the blockchain until its end state is reached Notifying SAP about the result of the approval process in the blockchain to switch the approval state of the SAP purchase order accordingly.

Body: It's got much easier to perform milestone payments for any of your projects! All you need to do is define the workflow visually and our smart contract will take care of the rest. As soon as the conditions for the payment are met, it will be sent to the employee. Find out more in this brief use case:  üë®Noam is a project manager at a construction company. He has to supervise the ongoing projects. When milestones are completed, he must trigger contractor payments.  Using the ERP system, Noam can see all milestone-based payments that have been agreed upon for each project. He continuously checks for new events the meet the necessary conditions within each project and he triggers milestone payments with his colleagues.  üë©Heidi, an accounting manager, is informed by Noam that a condition has been met and therefore a payment has to be made. She receives payment data by mail from Noam and performs each payment.  ‚ùìChallenge : Noam has to manually check all the milestones defined for each project. If the condition for payment is met, he has to inform the accounting manager and instruct her to perform the payment.  ‚úÖUsing Unibright Solution ‚ÄúMilestone Payment‚Äù Noam is able to input all the conditions for payments into the workflow designer. A Smart Contract is connected to the ERP system that checks whether a milestone-based payment is due.  The Unibright conformant smart contract continuously checks defined milestone conditions for payments that should be made. This enables all parties involved in each project to agree upon a payment plan based on terms that are executed reliably by the Unibright conformant smart contract.

Author: unibyte
Title: [ANN] unibright.io - Blockchain based business integration -
Body: Unibright is not a blockchain. It is a framework for blockchain based business integration. Our goal is to divide the complexity of business integration into the definition part and a generation part. The definition can be done by a process specialist without technical knowledge by using our visual oriented, blockchain independent tools. The smart contracts for a specific blockchain and all needed objects are then generated automatically by our framework, including connections to off-chain systems like SAP or Oracle and existing technologies like SOAP Webservices, FTP or Email.We define templates based on use cases, define integration workflows on a high level and generate all needed objects automatically. The Unibright framework supports the COMPLETE integration lifecycle: Choose a template for the desired use case, customize the integration workflow, generate code, connect to your existing landscape and monitor the ongoing business process.

Author: unibyte
Title: [ANN] unibright.io - Blockchain based business integration -
Body: We are business integration specialists, so Unibright brings benefit to all businesses that need to connect different systems, data formats and where parts of this integration benefits from blockchain‚Äôs promises. We have successfully done integration projects in the past, that still can be improved by Unibright e.g.:  A design company setting up an own approval process for each new designed piece of jewlery - integrating different roles and systems within the company and the manufacturer in China. Unibright empowers the German company to include the chinese manufacturer to being part of an automated approval by process by setting up a private chain. All outcome will be integrated into the german ERP system without the need of granting direct ERP access to the chinese manufacturer. A worldwide operating NGO raising funds from private persons. Due to an integration solution all raised funds are collected in the companies central IT system digitally. Unibright improves the process by sharing selected parts of the funding process in a public chain - offering the funders to understand what their funds have been used for. We developed a batch tracing system for a beer manufacturer. All raw materials, production stages and the sale to supermarkets are traced and integrated into the central system. Unibright improves the process by sharing the unique producers and consumers in a public chain, offering transparency to the end consumer.  From these projects we did in the past we developed our ‚ÄúTemplates‚Äù. They model the most common integration steps for these use cases to make them available to related industries or users. From these templates, all needed objects are generated automatically by Unibright. Unibright as a framework could offer hundreds of templates for different use cases and industries. These are just examples from OUR background, yet the framework aims to be an industry standard for all cases where on- and off-chain integration processes should be implemented based on a use case specific template.
